info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 01 at 7:10AM PDT until September 01 at 8:15AM PDT by NWS LasVegas
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 AM PDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southern Nevada, including the following county, Clark. * WHEN...Until 845 AM PDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 709 AM PDT, Doppler radar indicated fast moving thunderstorms with heavy rain entering the southwest Las Vegas Valley, moving northeast. Minor flooding is already occurring in the advisory area. Between 0.25 and 0.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Las Vegas, Henderson, North Las Vegas, Summerlin, Spring Valley, Lone Mountain, Blue Diamond, Mountains Edge, The Strip, Red Rock Canyon, Centennial Hills, Enterprise, Downtown Las Vegas, Paradise, Southern Highlands, Aliante, Green Valley, East Las Vegas, Spring Mountains and Red Rock Canyon Campground. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
